qas.question: Who assisted the French in taking forts Oswego and William Henry?
How did France's native allies treat the British prisoners?

answers.text: slaughtering and scalping soldiers and taking captive many men, women and children

qas.question: How did the French guard respond to the attack on the prisoners?

answers.text: the French refused to protect their captives

qas.question: How did the French defend the Fortress of Louisbourg?
What Canadian area had is seaward side protected by the defense of the Fortress of Louisbourg?

answers.text: securing the seaward approaches to Quebec.

context: In 1756 and 1757 the French captured forts Oswego and William Henry from the British. The latter victory was marred when <a0_0>France's native allies<a0_0/> broke the terms of capitulation and attacked the retreating British column, which was under French guard, <a1_0>slaughtering and scalping soldiers and taking captive many men, women and children<a1_0/> while <a2_0>the French refused to protect their captives<a2_0/>. <a3_0>French naval deployments<a3_0/> in 1757 also successfully defended the key Fortress of Louisbourg on Cape Breton Island, <a4_0>securing the seaward approaches to Quebec.
